properties.Title: Dangerous Person - Amherst
properties.Summary:
Description: Amherst Police Department are responding a complaint in regards to a possible sighting of a person who may have been in possession of a firearm in the area of Church and East Pleasant St. Police have been in contact with local schools and are checking the areas for a person on a bicycle wearing a reddish/orange hoodie, sweatpants and a vest that resembled a ballistic vest. Police are asking that people in the Church Street/East Pleasant Street area to remain in their houses until further notice.
Expires: 2020-10-21T13:00:00-03:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Province of NS, 2020-10-20T13:13:47-03:00, 6B707DE0-FC50-C706-90BE-229DFBFC61D3
Area: Amherst, Nova Scotia
properties.Author: Province of NS

properties.Title: Updated Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Town Of Lashburn On 1st Street West Between 1st And 2nd Avenues.
properties.Summary:
Description: Updated Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Lashburn. This Advisory applies to residents and users located on 1st Street West between 1st Avenue and 2nd Avenue in the Town of Lashburn effective October 19th, 2020 and until further notice. Clause 36(1)(a) of The Environmental Management and Protection Act, 2010 this Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory is issued due to depressurization caused by line maintenance and therefore the safety of the Townâ€™s drinking water supply cannot be ensured at all times. This Advisory is effective immediately and will not be lifted until the water supply is determined to be completely safe. If you require any additional information, please contact the following: Water Security Agency Media Inquiries 306-694-8914 Town Contact 306-285-3533 Water Security Agency EPO 306-446-7683 Saskatchewan Health Authority - North Battleford 1-800-567-4224
Expires: 2020-10-23T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Lashburn, 2020-10-19T15:01:23-06:00, 735733B0-7B55-708A-4F2D-01E678CE9679
Area: 1st Street West between 1st and 2nd Avenues in the Town of Lashburn.
properties.Author: SK Lashburn

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Persistent snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls are expected to develop over southern sections of Great Slave Lake beginning this evening. The squalls are expected to persist over the region on Wednesday and into Thursday, with localized snowfall amounts possibly reaching or exceeding 25 cm by Thursday night. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-21T08:16:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-20T16:17:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3315017566.2020
Area: Ft. Resolution Region including Hwy. 6
properties.Author: Environment Canada
